body:
Comment 4 by **amdragon**: 
CL is at: http://golang.org/cl/183104

I have two questions, though.

According to http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Semicolons, a semicolon is inserted 
after a "basic literal".  What makes a literal "basic"?  The CL assumes this means an 
integer, floating-point, character, or string literal.  Is this meant to distinguish 
from a composite or function literal (which are covered by the third bullet in the 
semicolons section)?

Before this change, the top level was grammatically special and had a form of 
semicolon insertion hard-coded into the grammar rules.  I wanted to confirm my 
understanding that the top level is now no different from any other code and does not 
need to be parsed or indented specially.
